means: 驹子（如驴驹）( foal的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: To Ellen, mares never foaled nor cows calved. In fact, hens almost didn't lay eggs.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于爱伦来说, 母马从不下驹儿,母牛从不产犊儿,当然, 母鸡也几乎是不生蛋的.

sentence.Network_en: Well, as to why I'm not riding today, Nellie foaled early this morning. "
sentence.Network_cn: 唔, 至于说到我今天怎没骑马, 那是因为乃利今天清早下 驹 儿了.

sentence.Network_en: One of the farmers owned a mare that had foaled in the marketplace.
sentence.Network_cn: 其中一个农夫拥有的一匹母马,在市场诞下了小马.

entry.def: A foal is a very young horse.
When a female horse foals, it gives birth.

example.ex: The mare is due to foal today.
example.tran: 母马今天要下小马驹了。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of a horse or related animal) born

auth_sentence.content: In 1917, Man o' War, the famous American race horse, was foaled.
auth_sentence.res_content: In 1917, Man o' War, the famous American race horse, was foaled.
